meanings.definition: A sweet stew of vegetables and fruit, often made with carrots and prunes.
meanings.sent1: My grandma makes the most delicious tzimmes with carrots and prunes.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday, we always enjoy a bowl of tzimmes with our meal.
meanings.sent3: The kids made a tzimmes in the kitchen trying to bake cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, creating a tzimmes of joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the tzimmes cooking on the stove filled the house with warmth.

meanings.sent1: There was a tzimmes at the party when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The meeting turned into a tzimmes when everyone started arguing.
meanings.sent3: The cat caused a tzimmes by knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside created a tzimmes of noise and chaos.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter caused a tzimmes in the playground.
